abstract: Scientists and public health experts are alarmed at practice of using insecticide-treated mosquito nets for fishing across Africa; nets, which have been widely hailed as contributing to decline in malarial infections, are not being used as intended but instead in place of traditional fishing nets; malarial infections are rising due to practice, and scientists worry insecticide and fine mesh construction of nets will damage fish populations.
lead_paragraph: The nets, with holes smaller than mosquitoes, trap much more than traditional fishing nets do and could wipe out stressed fish populations in Africa.
snippet: The nets, with holes smaller than mosquitoes, trap much more than traditional fishing nets do and could wipe out stressed fish populations in Africa.

headline.main: Meant to Keep Malaria Out, Mosquito Nets Are Used to Haul Fish In
headline.print_headline: Meant to Keep Mosquitoes Out, Nets Are Used to Haul Fish In
